channel.title: ES6 on Teach Me To Code
channel.description: Recent content in ES6 on Teach Me To Code

item.title: ES6 Maps, Weak Maps, and the Determinism of the JavaScript Garbage Collector
item.description: Let’s say you have an app with a number of objects, and you’d like to store metadata about certain objects. How would you do this? What I’ve been doing is creating a special object for the purpose, like so: var x = { uniqueIdentifier : "this is my first object" }; var y = { uniqueIdentifier : "this is my second object" }; var registry = {}; registry[x.uniqueIdentifier] = 'this object is okay'; registry[y.
